intro: Stilpnopappus scaposus, commonly known as the slender bristleweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a sprawling growth habit. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Stilpnopappus scaposus is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
